intro: Codonoboea flavobrunnea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered codonoboea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
